content.question:
The reactants are represented in the diagram.

A catalyst is added to the mixture and the reaction occurs. Which of the following is a correct particulate representation of the mixture after the reaction occurs?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of the mixture after a reaction occurred. In the diagram, there are two N 2 molecules, and two molecules that each consist of one N atom and three H atoms.

The figure presents a diagram of the mixture after a reaction occurred. In the diagram, there is one N 2 molecule, one H 2 molecule, and two molecules that each consist of one N atom and three H atoms.
The figure presents a diagram of the mixture after a reaction occurred. In the diagram, there are three molecules that each consist of one N atom and three H atoms.
The figure presents a diagram of the mixture after a reaction occurred. In the diagram, there are six molecules that each consist of one N atom and three H atoms.

content.answer: The figure presents a diagram of the mixture after a reaction occurred. In the diagram, there are two N 2 molecules, and two molecules that each consist of one N atom and three H atoms.
